column8: North}}</ref> died aged 250 years) was the fifth [[King of Arnor]].

column1: Arantar succeeded his father, [[Eldacar (King of Arnor)
column2: Eldacar]], when he died in 339. Arantar was the great-grandson of [[Isildur]], last [[High King of the Dúnedain
column3: High King]] of both [[Gondor]] and Arnor.

column1: He ruled uneventfully for ninety-six years, and was succeeded by his son, [[Tarcil]], when he died in 435.<ref name="North"/>
Arantar's name is [[Quenya]] for "Lord of Kings", from ''[[aran]]'' meaning "king", and ''[[táro]]'' or ''[[tar]]'' meaning "lord".

column2:
house=[[House of Isildur]]
Cadet branch of [[House of Elros]]
